title: Double slit - lambda from 1st-4th spot distance

content.question: A double slit with a slit spacing of <math alttext="5.00 times 10 raised to the negative 5 power meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.00</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> is used to determine the wavelength of a laser. When the laser is shined onto the double slit, the pattern shown in the figure is produced on a screen <math alttext="0.500 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.500</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> from the double slit. The first and fourth bright spots to the right of the central bright maximum are separated by a distance of <math alttext="4.50 times 10 raised to the negative 2 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4.50</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math>, as indicated. What is the wavelength of the laser?
